edu.rit.gpu.example

Class KnapsackSC

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.gpu.example.KnapsackSC
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KnapsackProblem

    public class KnapsackSC
extends java.lang.Object
implements KnapsackProblem
    Class KnapsackSC provides an object that defines a strongly correlated knapsack problem. The definition consists of the knapsack capacity, the number of items, and the weight and value of each item. Each item's weight is chosen uniformly at random in the range 1 through maxW inclusive. Each item's value is equal to its weight plus deltaV, where deltaV may be positive, zero, or negative.

    • Constructor Detail

      • KnapsackSC

        public KnapsackSC(long C,
          int N,
          long maxW,
          long deltaV,
          long seed)
        Construct a new strongly correlated knapsack problem.
        Parameters:
        C - Knapsack capacity ≥ 1.
        N - Number of items ≥ 1.
        maxW - Maximum item weight ≥ 1.
        deltaV - Item value delta.
        seed - Pseudorandom number generator seed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if any argument is not in the stated range.

      • next

        public WV next()
        Get the weight and value of the next item. This method must be called N times to get all the items. Each method call returns a new WV object.
        Specified by:
        next in interface KnapsackProblem
        Returns:
        Weight/value.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if this method is called more than N times.
